column4: Can anyone help me with a mencoder subtitle problem? I try to hardcode subtitles (srt) into a avi file and my subs are always a bit transparent on yellow and blue backgrounds.
sorry... wrong channel
which channel supports mencoder
worth a try if no-one here responds
I already did, just have to wait for a response... but that's no problem
I see some google threads about changing subtitle colors in mencoder...
The color isn't the problem. White is ok for subtitles, but when the movie has yellow or blue parts behind the subtitle, the color shines thru
is this relevant: http://lists.mplayerhq.hu/pipermail/mencoder-users/2008-February/008025.html
I haven't converted my subtitles to ssa/ass yet, but I can give it a try.
it's not clear to me their solution works for everyone. At your own risk. Perhaps a different encoder might be easier?
mencoder is the only program that will hardcode subtitles at good performance. the only alternative I found was avidemux, but it takes about 3 times longer to encode the same file.
a slow workaround is better than no workaround at all...
thats true
if you're going to be doing this a lot, by all means hand patch mencoder source. But unless you're unused to doing such things, or it's a one-off encode, it might be more trouble than it's worth
patching and compiling are no problem. My mencoder already has the -ass option, so I about to give it a try
unused -> used
ok, that's some progress at least
it works. ssa/aas subtitles are the solution.
excellent. google to the rescue!
I already read the post, but I never thought of converting my subtitles to ssa
cool, so I added some value, even better....!
